CONJUGATES: blockades (n plural) | blockades (v 3rd person singular present) | blockading (v present participle) | blockaded (v past tense) | blockaded (v past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Dutch blokkade, from blok 'block' + -ade (from French -ade), dating from the mid-17th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An act or means of sealing off a place to prevent goods or people from entering or leaving.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对一个地点进行封锁，以阻止货物或人员进出。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The navy imposed a strict blockade on all enemy ports.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 海军对所有敌方港口实施了严格的封锁。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To prevent access to or from a place, especially by using military force or economic sanctions.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 阻止某地的人员或物资进出，尤指通过使用军事力量或经济制裁。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Protesters attempted to blockade the main entrance to the building.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 抗议者试图封锁大楼的主要入口。
